newsitem.title: EGYPT: FBI chief in Egypt to open legal attache office.
newsitem.headline: FBI chief in Egypt to open legal attache office.

text.p: U.S. Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) director Louis Freeh arrived in Egypt on Friday for anti-terror talks with President Hosni Mubarak and other senior officials, airport and U.S. embassy sources said.
Freeh is scheduled to meet Mubarak, Foreign Minister Amr Moussa and Interior Minister Hassan el-Alfi, U.S. embassy spokesman Rick Roberts said.
He said the FBI chief would open a legal attache office in Cairo during his three day-visit as he did during a trip to Tel Aviv earlier in the week.
"This reflects (U.S.) President (Bill) Clinton's commitment to expand U.S. anti-terror and international crime-fighting responsibilities," a U.S. embassy press release said.

An official with the FBI said in January that a New York police-FBI anti-terrorist task force was working closely with authorities in Egypt after several letter bombs with an Alexandria, Egypt postmark were sent to the United States.
Mubarak has expressed doubt the bombs came from Egypt.
